intro: Martynia louisianica, commonly known as the Louisiana fireflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous annual that produces striking red-orange flowers with a distinctive, fiery appearance. The plant belongs to the family Solanaceae, which includes nightshades, and is characterized by its small, glandular leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. The flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
